<p>Use try-except to handle the error and repeat it again:</p>
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>:
    <span class="hljs-keyword">try</span>:
        age = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>(<span class="hljs-built_in">input</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Please enter your age: "</span>))
        <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> age &gt;= <span class="hljs-number">18</span>:
            <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"You are able to vote in the United States!"</span>)
        <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:
            <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"You are not able to vote in the United States."</span>)
    <span class="hljs-keyword">except</span> Exception <span class="hljs-keyword">as</span> e:
        <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"please enter number"</span>)
</code></pre>

<p>While a <code>try</code>/<code>except</code> block will work, a much faster and cleaner way to accomplish this task would be to use <code>str.isdigit()</code>.</p>

<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>:
    age = <span class="hljs-built_in">input</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Please enter your age: "</span>)
    <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> age.isdigit():
        age = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>(age)
        <span class="hljs-keyword">break</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:
        <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"Invalid number '{age}'. Try again."</span>.<span class="hljs-built_in">format</span>(age=age))

<span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> age &gt;= <span class="hljs-number">18</span>: 
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"You are able to vote in the United States!"</span>)
<span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:
    <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">"You are not able to vote in the United States."</span>)
</code></pre>

<p>You can try to convert it to a integer, but ask the user to repeat if it doesn't work.</p>
<pre class="lang-py s-code-block"><code class="hljs language-python"><span class="hljs-keyword">while</span> <span class="hljs-literal">True</span>:
    age = <span class="hljs-built_in">input</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'Please enter your age: '</span>)
    <span class="hljs-keyword">try</span>:
        age_int = <span class="hljs-built_in">int</span>(age)
        <span class="hljs-keyword">if</span> age_int &gt;= <span class="hljs-number">18</span>:
            <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'You can vote in the United States!'</span>)
        <span class="hljs-keyword">else</span>:
            <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'You cannot vote in the United States.'</span>)
        <span class="hljs-keyword">break</span>
    <span class="hljs-keyword">except</span>:
        <span class="hljs-built_in">print</span>(<span class="hljs-string">'Please enter a meaningful answer.'</span>)
        
</code></pre>
<p>The while loop runs as long as the user has not inputted a meaningful answer, but breaks if it makes sense.</p>
